text: <@U2Y2V95D2|alanlee> has joined the channel
Can you please confirm if the security is enables in core.yaml?
<@U1AU8DRQR> How to you progressing with implementing the TCerts?
<@U1Y2R5C9L>  security is not enabled

<@U1F1CU61Y> TCerts are not yet implemented in the SDK, however with the default configuration, server does not ask for TCerts. I am not sure why it is asking. <@U0KN2SSKE> is there a way to configure server not to ask TCerts?
<@U1Y2R5C9L> thank you
<@U1Y2R5C9L> is fabric-java-sdk is compatible with fabric v0.6-dev-preview ?
yes
thanks
<@U1Y2R5C9L>  can i deploy a jar file as chaincode ?
<@U1F1CU61Y> No, it needs to build from source
GO and Java chaincodes are supported yet, but this is a good point. I think we should allow deploying from jar file
actually i want to build a chaincode in which one event happen it will consume a rest service of third party and will upload that data
is this possible ?
yeah you should think about deploying through jar file
yes, you can include jar files as dependencies
frankly speaking, it is possible to deploy a jar, but all you need to have is creade the gradle file that can run the jar file
Okay so i just want to ask that i have seen all the examples there is just a single class file. I want to deploy multiple class files
Okay i will try that
you can do that, no restriction on that
sdk will compress your entire directory (does not matter how many files you have got), unzip it in container, build the source and create appropriate jar file at paths required by the container
thanks
and one more thing i want to use field level access how can i do that ?\
field level access?
yeah suppose i created table and i want to give access to modify column1 to only user type1 and column2 to user type2
is it possible ?
I am not very good at chaincode itself, probably <@U0YNFB22X>  can help you with that
okay <@U1Y2R5C9L> thanks a lot
<@U0YNFB22X> can you please help me in that ?
<@U1F1CU61Y> yes, you will have to implement that logic in your chaincode, you can use ACL yo do that.
How can i do that ?
i think for that i need to get enrollment certificate of user and get user type from it
am i right ?
Yes..
You will have to use java sdk jar as your dependency instead of shim-client
Okay i will try that
one more thing i am getting error "Missing transaction certificate" when it tries to do transact over rest api
i am running test cases with fabric-java-sdk
<@U1F1CU61Y> <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric-sdk-java/blob/master/src/main/java/org/hyperledger/fabric/sdk/shim/ChaincodeStub.java#L463>
When you use sdk you are not doing it over rest anymore
